Method Detail

findMatches

public static java.util.ArrayList<Result> findMatches(Query query,
                                                      DataManager myVocab)
Finds results for a given query

Parameters:
query - a Query object that the JSON query request will be parsed into
myVocab - aVocabManager object which contains information about the vocabulary against which the query term will be compared.
Returns:
An ArrayList of Result objects, which will be parsed into a JSON response

getDirectMatches

private static java.util.ArrayList<Result> getDirectMatches(DataManager myVocab,
                                                            java.lang.String querystr,
                                                            java.lang.String originalQuerystr,
                                                            java.lang.String type)
This function does matching via direct matching

Parameters:
querystr - a string of the query term
myVocab - A VocabManager object (for the vocabulary)
originalQuerystr - Because the query may be modified, it's useful to get original query term
type - The vocab type.
Returns:
An ArrayList of Result objects that are closer than the maxScore allowable.

distanceMatching

private static java.util.ArrayList<Result> distanceMatching(Query query,
                                                            DataManager myVocab)
This function does matching via edit distance. It is useful in finding typos

Parameters:
query - A Query object (for the query term)
myVocab - a VocabManager object (for the vocabulary)
Returns:
An ArrayList of Result objects that are closer than the maxScore allowable.

min

private static int min(int one,
                       int two,
                       int three)
This function returns the number that is the minimum of three ints. it is used by the LevenshteinDistance function

Parameters:
one - an integer to be compared to two others
two - an integer to be compared to two others
three - an integer to be compared to two others
Returns:
The integer of the three which is the smallest

levenshteinDistance

private static int levenshteinDistance(java.lang.String vocabTerm,
                                       java.lang.String queryTerm)
This function calculates a Levenshtein Distance Matrix and returns a number for the match value between one vocabulary term and a query term. It is based off of the pseudocode found at: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levenshtein_distance

Parameters:
vocabTerm - A string to be compared to the second string
queryTerm - A second string to be compared to the first string
Returns:
The distance score for the two strings

pruneResults

private static java.util.ArrayList<Result> pruneResults(java.util.ArrayList<Result> pruneThis,
                                                        int limit)
A function that decreases the number of result objects to be returned for a particular query. Google Refine, in particular, hard-codes a limit of results that will be displayed. This allows for response queries to be only as long as will be used.

Parameters:
pruneThis - An ArrayList of Result objects.
limit - The limit in the query request. It is hardcoded in Google Refine as 3.
Returns:
An ArrayList of Result objects with a max number of entries.

removeDuplicates

private static java.util.ArrayList<Result> removeDuplicates(java.util.ArrayList<Result> toDeDup)
A function that checks the ArrayList of result objects for duplicates. Because of the overlap between some of the methods, a positive result may be found for the same vocabulary term twice. This function deletes all but one entry for each term and it reports the highest score

Parameters:
toDeDup - An ArrayList of Result objects.
Returns:
An ArrayList of Result objects without any duplicates

bagOfWords

private static java.util.ArrayList<Result> bagOfWords(Query query,
                                                      DataManager myVocab)
This function breaks a query term down into individual words and tries to find a result based on each word in the query term. The scores are decremented based on how many words are in the original Query term.

Parameters:
query - A Query
myVocab - A VocabManager
Returns:
An ArrayList of Result objects from the search.

sortByScore

private static java.util.ArrayList<Result> sortByScore(java.util.ArrayList<Result> sortThis)
A function that users Collections.sort function to sort the Result objects by their score. It has to reverse the sort, as the Collections.sort function returns the results in ascending order and we want the results in descending.

Parameters:
sortThis - An ArrayList of Result objects not sorted.
Returns:
A sorted ArrayList of Result objects
